window dressing.translation[0].definitio: something that is intended to make people like your plans or activities, and to stop them seeing the true situation – used to show disapproval
All these glossy pamphlets are just window dressing – the fact is that the new mall will ruin the neighborhood.
the art of arranging goods in a shop window so that they look attractive to customers
window dressing.translation[1].definitio: when people try to give the public a favourable idea about something, sometimes hiding the true situation
Stock prices benefited from window dressing by some money managers anxious to present good reports to clients.
the art of arranging goods in a shop window so that they look attractive to customers
